notes: A collection of important AI-related terms and definitions.

terms.definition: A branch of computer science in which computer systems use data to draw inferences, perform tasks, and solve problems with human-like reasoning.
A subset of AI that enables systems to automatically learn and improve from experience without being explicitly programmed.
A series of algorithms that mimic the operations of a human brain to recognize relationships in a set of data.
A subset of ML where algorithms are structured in layers to create artificial neural networks that can learn and make intelligent decisions on their own.
A field of AI focused on enabling computers to understand, interpret, and respond to human language.
Data used to train machine learning models to recognize patterns or make decisions.
A modeling error that occurs when a machine learning model fits the training data too closely, limiting its ability to generalize to new data.
Systematic and repeatable errors in a computer system that create unfair outcomes due to inaccurate assumptions in the machine learning process.
A large collection of textual datasets used to train an LLM.
A set of rules or instructions given to an AI, neural network, or machine learning program to help it learn on its own.
A process in machine learning used to categorize data into predefined classes or groups.
A type of predictive modeling technique in machine learning, used to predict a continuous outcome based on input variables.
A machine learning approach where models are trained on labeled data, meaning each input has a corresponding output.
A type of machine learning that works with unlabeled data, aiming to uncover patterns or groupings within the data.
An area of machine learning where agents learn by performing actions and receiving rewards or penalties.
The process through which organization-specific knowledge is added into the prompt and the foundation model.
The technique of creating new data points from existing data by applying transformations to increase the amount of training data.
A field of AI that enables machines to interpret and make decisions based on visual data, such as images or videos.
A mathematical representation of words, sentences, or data points as vectors, used to capture semantic meaning.
A parameter whose value is set before the learning process begins, influencing the behavior and accuracy of a machine learning model.
The process of selecting, modifying, or creating features that improve the performance of a machine learning model.
A machine learning technique where a model trained on one task is adapted for a similar but different task.
An optimization algorithm used to minimize the error in machine learning models by adjusting the model parameters.
A function in neural networks that determines if a neuron should be activated, adding non-linear properties to the model.
The process of finding the optimal settings for a machine learning model to achieve the best performance.
A graphical plot that illustrates the diagnostic ability of a binary classifier as its discrimination threshold varies.
A metric that measures the accuracy of positive predictions in a classification model.
A metric that measures the ability of a model to identify all relevant instances within a dataset.
The harmonic mean of precision and recall, used to evaluate a model's accuracy on a specific class.
